section.title: Web-based Administration Overview
section.p: blojsom uses a set of plugins to add web-based administration capabilities where you are able to edit authorized users who can post to your blog, modify blog properties, add/edit/delete entries, add/edit/delete blog categories, modify flavors, modify plugin chains, modify templates, upload files to your blog, and modify users of your blojsom installation.

section.title: Authorizing Users for the Administration Console
section.p:
Authorized users are added to the /WEB-INF/(user-id)/authorization.properties file. The usernames and passwords in this file control the users that can access the individual blog either via the administration console or XML-RPC. The format of this file is as follows.
username=password
Each separate line represents an individual username and password combination.

section.title: Accessing the Administration Console
section.p: blojsom reserves one of the flavors defined in the individual user's flavor.properties file for the administration functionality. The default administration flavor is admin. You can access the administration console of your blog by adding ?flavor=admin when accessing your blog. At the login prompt for the administration console, use one of the authorized usernames and passwords that you setup in the /WEB-INF/(user-id)/authorization.properties file.
